intro: Chaenostoma oxypetalum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved waterplantain, is a flowering plant native to wetland habitats in North America. It belongs to the family Alismataceae and is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves that float on the water's surface. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in shallow, still or slow-moving freshwater environments. Its botanical features make it an important indicator species for aquatic ecosystem health.
